name: Brasilia Cathedral
description: Brasilia is the capital city of Brazil, known for its iconic Cathedral of Brasilia - a stunning modernist church designed by Oscar Niemeyer. The city is a UNESCO World Heritage site, featuring innovative modernist architecture, the distinctive hyperboloid cathedral structure, and the unique urban planning of the 1960s.

name: Buenos Aires Tango
description: Buenos Aires is the capital and largest city of Argentina, known for its passionate tango culture, historic neighborhoods like La Boca and San Telmo, and European-style architecture. The city is the cultural heart of Argentina and a major Latin American metropolis.

name: Cusco Inca Wall
description: Cusco is a historic city in southeastern Peru, once the capital of the Inca Empire. Known for its impressive Inca stone walls and architecture, the city features the famous Twelve-Angled Stone and other remarkable examples of Inca masonry. Cusco combines ancient Andean heritage with Spanish colonial architecture.

name: Rio de Janeiro Christ the Redeemer
description: Rio de Janeiro is a vibrant coastal city in Brazil, known for its iconic Christ the Redeemer statue atop Corcovado Mountain, beautiful beaches like Copacabana and Ipanema, and the famous Sugarloaf Mountain. The city combines stunning natural beauty with rich Brazilian culture and Carnival celebrations.

name: Santiago Metropolitan Cathedral
description: Santiago is the capital and largest city of Chile, known for its historic Metropolitan Cathedral and rich cultural heritage. The city combines colonial architecture with modern development, featuring the Plaza de Armas, Cerro San Cristóbal, and vibrant cultural scene.

name: São Paulo Sé Metropolitan Cathedral
description: São Paulo is the largest city in Brazil and the Americas, known for its iconic Sé Metropolitan Cathedral - a stunning neo-Gothic cathedral in the heart of the city. The city combines modern skyscrapers with historic architecture, featuring the famous Paulista Avenue, the beautiful Ibirapuera Park, the historic downtown area, and vibrant multicultural scene.

name: Montevideo Sun of May
description: Montevideo is the capital and largest city of Uruguay, known for its iconic Sun of May symbol that appears on both the Uruguayan and Argentine flags. This golden sun represents independence and freedom, commemorating the May Revolution and serving as a powerful symbol of South American liberation and national identity.

name: Lima Francisco Pizarro Statue
description: Lima, the capital of Peru, features the equestrian statue of Francisco Pizarro, the Spanish conquistador who founded the city in 1535. This monument represents Lima's colonial heritage and its role as the former capital of the Spanish Viceroyalty of Peru, marking the beginning of Spanish influence in South America.

name: Córdoba City Arch
description: Córdoba is represented by its distinctive city arch, a triumphal monument that features two Spanish medieval-style towers with strong reminiscences of Romanesque art. The design draws the shield of the City of Córdoba twice and joins them with a bow, creating an eclectic and characteristic arch. Each tower stands 18.6 meters high with a 6-meter diameter, connected by a bridge that forms this unique architectural symbol of the city.

name: Bogotá Cathedral
description: Bogotá is the capital and largest city of Colombia, known for its stunning Primatial Cathedral located on the historic Plaza Bolívar. This impressive neoclassical cathedral, one of the largest in South America, represents the spiritual heart of the nation and reflects Colombia's rich colonial heritage. The city combines historic charm with modern development, featuring the colorful La Candelaria district and vibrant cultural scene.

name: Medellín Cable Car
description: Medellín is Colombia's second-largest city, famous for its innovative Metrocable system - an aerial cable car network that connects hillside neighborhoods to the city center. This pioneering urban transportation solution has become a symbol of Medellín's remarkable transformation from a troubled past to a model of urban innovation and social inclusion, earning the city international recognition for its creative approach to public transit.

name: Cartagena Pedro de Heredia Statue
description: Cartagena is a stunning Caribbean coastal city in Colombia, known for its beautifully preserved colonial architecture and the statue of Pedro de Heredia, the Spanish conquistador who founded the city in 1533. The monument stands as a testament to Cartagena's colonial origins, while the city itself enchants visitors with its colorful walled Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage site, romantic plazas, and vibrant Caribbean culture.

name: Ushuaia Penguin
description: Ushuaia is the southernmost city in the world, located in Argentine Patagonia at the tip of South America. Known as the 'End of the World,' this remote city is famous for its colonies of Magellanic and gentoo penguins that inhabit the nearby islands and coastlines. The penguin has become a beloved symbol of Ushuaia, representing the city's unique position as a gateway to Antarctica and its extraordinary subpolar wildlife.
